Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can represent different plants and animals, including fish, in their drawing.
The student can identify and label the places where each plant and animal, including fish, live in the drawing.
The student can show the resources that plants and animals, including fish, need (like water, air, and land resources such as rocks).
The student can represent how fish need water to swim and live in their drawing.
The student can illustrate the connection between where fish live and the resources available in those places (such as drawn water environments for fish).
The student can demonstrate that the elements in the drawing (like plants, fish, and their environments) are parts of a system where all parts work together to meet needs.
